function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code is failing tests because the 'created_at' field in the Post class is a datetime object, but when it's converted to JSON, it becomes a string. This discrepancy is causing the tests to fail. A possible improvement would be to standardize the 'created_at' field to always be a string in the ISO 8601 format, which is widely used in APIs. This way, the 'created_at' field would be consistent across the application and the tests.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The current implementation of the API does not include any form of data persistence. This means that if the server is restarted, all the data about users and posts will be lost. To improve this, a database could be integrated into the application to store user and post data. This would allow data to persist across server restarts and provide a more robust solution.
